rounds.observation:
Welcome to the Trading Arena! You are Player 0 in this competitive resource exchange game.
Your goal is to maximize your wealth by strategically trading resources with your opponent.
Your current resource portfolio includes:
	+ [Wheat]   Qty: 24   Value: 5
	+ [Wood]    Qty: 9    Value: 8
	+ [Sheep]   Qty: 19   Value: 18
	+ [Brick]   Qty: 8    Value: 26
	+ [Ore]     Qty: 18   Value: 38
Each turn provides an opportunity to negotiate with your trading partner.
To interact effectively, use these action commands:
  - '[Offer: 4 Wood, 1 Brick -> 2 Ore, 3 Wheat]': Format - [Offer: What_You_Give -> What_You_Want]
  - '[Accept]': Use this to accept any pending trade proposal.
  - '[Deny]': Use this to reject any pending trade proposal (this is the default response).
This trading session will continue for exactly 10 rounds.

Welcome to the Trading Arena! You are Player 1 in this competitive resource exchange game.
Your goal is to maximize your wealth by strategically trading resources with your opponent.
Your current resource portfolio includes:
	+ [Wheat]   Qty: 21   Value: 6
	+ [Wood]    Qty: 19   Value: 9
	+ [Sheep]   Qty: 13   Value: 15
	+ [Brick]   Qty: 17   Value: 22
	+ [Ore]     Qty: 5    Value: 40
Each turn provides an opportunity to negotiate with your trading partner.
To interact effectively, use these action commands:
  - '[Offer: 4 Wood, 1 Brick -> 2 Ore, 3 Wheat]': Format - [Offer: What_You_Give -> What_You_Want]
  - '[Accept]': Use this to accept any pending trade proposal.
  - '[Deny]': Use this to reject any pending trade proposal (this is the default response).
This trading session will continue for exactly 10 rounds.
 Player 0 made the following offer to Player 1: Offered items: 10 Sheep -> Requested items: 5 Ore
rounds.response:
I need to evaluate the current offer: 10 Sheep for 5 Ore.  
Current values: Sheep = 15, Ore = 40.

Offer cost to me if I accept: 5 Ore × 40 = 200 value.  
Offer value I receive: 10 Sheep × 15 = 150 value.  
Net loss = 200 – 150 = 50 value.

Accepting would reduce my total wealth by 50 points, so this deal is unfavorable.

[Deny]

rounds.response:
Let me evaluate the latest offer step by step.

Current resources  
- Sheep: 13 × 15 = 195 value  
- Ore: 5 × 40 = 200 value  

Offer on the table  
- Receive: 10 Sheep (10 × 15 = 150) + 1 Brick (1 × 22 = 22)  → 172 value  
- Give: 5 Ore (5 × 40 = 200)  

That’s a net loss of 28 value (172 − 200 = –28).

Since the deal leaves me worse off, I reject it and instead start a counter-offer that benefits me more.

[Offer: 3 Wheat -> 1 Ore]

rounds.response:
Let’s put the numbers under the microscope.

Player 0’s most recent offer  
6 Wheat (value 6 each) → 1 Brick (value 22 each)  
Value flowing to me: 6 × 6 = 36  
Value flowing away from me: 1 × 22 = 22  
Net gain = +14 value for me – strictly preferable.

Since every point of value counts toward final wealth, accepting is strictly optimal here.

[Accept]
